page.title: 09WEATHER -LOCAL CLIMATE
page.content: The general climate is harsher than nationally.We get more rain,wind and snow;we get less sun and it is cooler. The two main villages Hepworth and Jackson Bridge are in sheltered places,which is one reason they developed there. As one walks up from the valley to the top the difference in temperature and exposure is very noticeable."It's a top coat warmer in the valley",they say. The people on higher ground like Hullock thought they got much more wind.They felt that the wind meant the rain was worse and the snow drifted more. They thought that they got more sun on the higher ground.These places felt they got a lot of low cloud fog while the lower areas had more ground mist. The people at Snug Lane said that they were on the snow line. General opinion seemed to be that the wind was worst.
